system.description:
You have become a true expert on enchanted items and your familiarity allows you to do things that most cannot with the magic items you wield. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Intelligence or wielder spellcasting ability increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You can attune a 4th magic item.
  • Your attunement ending benefit from Antiquity Expert can now be used a number of times equal to half your proficiency bonus between long rests. In addition, when you use it, you can emit a pulse of magical energy that interferes with the magic of others. Hostile creatures within 30 feet of you that are concentrating must make a Wisdom save against your wielder spell save DC or lose concentration.
  • As an action, you can spend artifact charges to restore charges to a magic item that has them. 
    • You can restore a charge to a common item by spending 1 artifact charge.
    • You can restore a charge to an uncommon item by spending 2 artifact charges.
    • You can restore a charge to a rare item by spending 4 artifact charges.
    • You can restore a charge to a very rare item by spending 6 artifact charges.
    • You cannot restore charges to legendary items or artifacts this way, and if an item normally has a finite number of charges that do not replenish in any other way (such as in the case of a @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-adventuring-gear.Item.js4qafwc3t10mb4k]{Nine Lives Stealer}), you also cannot restore those charges with this benefit.
